title: [Large-Scale] Social Responsibility-Based Citizen Participation Instructional Design Scenario for BLS Basic Life Support Education

context.prior_knowledge: No foundational medical knowledge. However, possesses general understanding of community safety and basic first aid concepts, as well as awareness of public responsibility and social relationship-building as a citizen.
context.additional_context: Conducted via a smartphone-based LMS in asynchronous learning environments for office/administrative professionals. It aims to enhance patient safety and obtain certifications through BLS skill acquisition. Post-training participation in community emergency responder networks strengthens civic collaboration systems and cultural dissemination.

learning_goals: Learners perform adult/child CPR in stepwise sequences with ≥85% accuracy, cultivating social responsibility and public safety competencies as citizens in community emergency response
Learners apply AED usage without errors across three practice scenarios, strengthening compliance with public space safety protocols and awareness of citizen rights protection

Learners adhere to role allocation and communication protocols in 2-person collaborative CPR scenarios with ≥90% compliance, developing civic engagement and institutional improvement capabilities for community cooperation systems

Learners submit case analysis reports based on international BLS guidelines (ILCOR standards), proposing institutional improvement plans and citizen collaboration models for community health promotion

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
